definition: to visit/to pay a call to
to see/to look at/to read/to watch/to visit/to call on/to consider/to regard as/to look after/to treat (an illness)/to depend on/to feel (that)/(after verb) to give it a try/Watch out! (for a danger)
to look after/to take care of/to watch/to guard
full moon/to hope/to expect/to visit/to gaze (into the distance)/to look towards/towards
15th day of month (lunar calendar)/old variant of 望[wang4]

sentences.english: I must ask you to still visit with me. My feelings inside do not change.
sentences.chinese: 我求你一定要经常看望我，我内心的感情没有变。

sentences.english: A frend is going to visit a girl you know well.
sentences.chinese: 一个朋友正准备去看望你很熟悉的一个女孩子。

sentences.english: Professor Li is often visited by his students.
sentences.chinese: 学生们常去看望李教授。

sentences.english: I'm going to call on one of my former classmates.
sentences.chinese: 我要去看望我的一位老同学。

sentences.english: Can we ask for leave to see our roommate in the hospital?
sentences.chinese: 我们能请假去医院看望我们同寝室的同学吗？

sentences.english: Did you come to London to see your family or for business purposes?
sentences.chinese: 你来伦敦是看望家人还是公干？

sentences.english: Jane visited her mother every Sunday afternoon.
sentences.chinese: 每周日下午简都有去看望她的母亲。

sentences.english: Just pull not see his face just good sisters.
sentences.chinese: 只不过是拉不下脸看望自己的好姐妹而已。

sentences.english: One morning, several weeks later, Professor Baglioni visited Giovanni.
sentences.chinese: 几周后的一个早晨，柏格罗尼教授来看望乔凡尼。

sentences.english: Nathan finally told Father Willenborg he did not want to see him.
sentences.chinese: 内森最后告诉韦伦伯格，他不想去看望他。

sentences.english: I'm go to visit my grorpare notnts the weekend?
sentences.chinese: 这个周末我打算去看望我的外祖爸妈。

sentences.english: He went to see his parents in the country every three weeks.
sentences.chinese: 他每隔两周去看望他乡下的父母。

sentences.english: I was visiting an aunt who had always been heavy.
sentences.chinese: 我去看望一位婶娘，他的身体一直超重。

sentences.english: I’ve spent the last few days visiting my Mom in St. Louis.
sentences.chinese: 前几天，我去看望住在圣路易斯的妈妈。

sentences.english: The picture shows Wang Guoqiang "Green Harbour" visit the children.
sentences.chinese: 图为王国强在“绿色港湾”看望孩子们。

sentences.english: You're right. Let's just get on. I'll see you outside before you see me.
sentences.chinese: 你所言极是，好好活下去，我将在外头第一个看望你。

definition: to visit/to call on sb/to look around
to express sympathy, greetings, consolation etc
to pay a visit/to call on
to visit (a patient, prisoner etc)/to look inquiringly
to visit a sick person or patient
specifically/specially (for that purpose)
to take care of/to show consideration/to attend to/to look after
seriously ill
to go home to visit one's family
to go back to one's roots/to return to one's native place/by ext. to join one's ancestors (i.e. to die)
to accompany/to keep sb company/to assist/old variant of 賠|赔[pei2]
to (try to) find the time to
to accompany
to look after/to attend to/to have in care
to send to/to deliver to/to give sb a lift (e.g. in a car)
to be critically ill/to be terminally ill
